text: Francesco de Marchi (1610 - 1 Nov 1667) was a Roman Catholic prelate who served as Bishop of Krk (1660–1667)."Bishop Francesco de Marchi" Catholic- Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved March 21, 2016"Diocese of Krk (Veglia)" Catholic-Hierarchy.org. David M. Cheney. Retrieved February 29, 2016"Diocese of Krk" GCatholic.org. Gabriel Chow. Retrieved February 29, 2016 ==Biography== Francesco de Marchi was born in Split, Croatia in 1610. On 21 Jun 1660, he was appointed during the papacy of Pope Alexander VII as Bishop of Krk. On 27 Jun 1660, he was consecrated bishop by Giulio Cesare Sacchetti, Cardinal-Bishop of Sabina, with Lorenzo Gavotti, Bishop Emeritus of Ventimiglia, with Giovanni Agostino Marliani, Bishop Emeritus of Accia and Mariana, serving as co-consecrators. He served as Bishop of Krk until his death on 1 Nov 1667. == References == Category:17th-century Roman Catholic bishops Category:Bishops appointed by Pope Alexander VII Category:1610 births Category:1667 deaths Category:People from Split, Croatia
title: Francesco de Marchi
